info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:05PM CDT until June 15 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN GRANT...NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN SALINE... NORTHEASTERN HOT SPRING AND SOUTHEASTERN PULASKI COUNTIES... At 504 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Haskell, or near Benton, moving east at 30 mph. This storm has a history of producing golf ball sized hail, most recently near Lonsdale, and is consistently producing quarter sized hail along its path. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... Benton... Bryant... Sheridan... White Hall... Haskell... Shannon Hills... Wrightsville... Redfield... Traskwood... Tull... Cane Creek... Ironton... Estes... East End... Orion... Mabelvale... Salem in Saline County... Hensley Island... Pine Bluff Arsenal... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
